Posts.Content: Oct 4, 2011 10:24AM Deep81 wrote: Stay positive as hard as that can be. You will go to your daughters communion-you just need to keep that faith and positivity alive. I was diagnosed with breast mets to the lung 3 weeks ago and yes it was a shock but now i live each to the fullest and I am looking forward to meeting my niece/nephew next year! I will not let doctors/statistics make me think i have limited time here. I am visiting a Naturopath Oncologist this week for alternative therapies to help kill off the cancer cells lingering in my lungs. Apparantly alot of patients like us with Mets have had succcess with these therapies. But we have to make sure they do not interact with the chemo regime we have been assigned to. Maybe a thought for you to consider perhaps? I havent come across your regime but research as much as you can and also see if you can talk to other patients in your hospital who are currently on it? Hugs
Posts.Title: Scan results and not a great day... LouiseBogle jeanne46

Posts.Title: Does anyone have contact info for Stephanie - TripleNegative?? Analemma Deep81

Posts.Content: Dec 20, 2011 09:21AM Deep81 wrote: hey ladies! so sorry for being MIA! life has been super busy recently with appts, work and christmas shopping! a sincere thank you for being concerned- i really appreciate it! i had my left lung drained 2 weeks ago and it was pretty painful, radiation knocked me out for 2 weeks too and then i had christmas parties, lunches, temple/church ceremonies etc! December has been busy! Cant wait for Christmas day!!!  i just started cycle 2 of Xeloda- my counts were good and the doctor is surprised that i am looking better on it- i thank God everyday for giving me the strength and the courage to beat this demon! Life is good!
Posts.Title: Looking for Deep81 BlueCowgirl Heidihill

Posts.Content: Oct 20, 2011 01:32PM Deep81 wrote: Proactive active ingredient is benzoyl peroxide it just has some added ingredients so that your skin doesnt dry out too much. Proactive is around $40 over here in Canada, but the Benzoyl P on its own from walmart is about $10. I would say talk to your doctor abt it as he may prescribe something stronger like clindamycin or erthromycin.
Posts.Title: Zits, boils, WTH? Canchaser Heidihill

Posts.Content: Nov 10, 2011 01:23PM Deep81 wrote: better to be safe than sorry-get it checked again. I was 29 when i was diagnosed and my family doctor did not seem bothered that i had a lump. I had to push for testing and after 4 months I went private and low and behold it was breast cancer. Not trying to scare you but time is valuable so you are better off getting checked sooner than later
Posts.Title: only 29 do I need to worry about breast cancer? cmurtaugh Deep81

Posts.Content: Oct 19, 2011 04:25PM Deep81 wrote: hey there, i got alot of zits on my face and chest after starting gemcitabine/Cisplastin but i used benzol peroxide 5% each night and they cleared up after a week. i guess the chemo is whacking the hormones out of shape so zits pop up! but yes much better than throwing up for sure! i hate the nausea associated with chemo and the dexamethosone steroids !
